result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasey Ray Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Huber revoked. Loss of all good time. Jail violations.

Cases called at 3:40 p.m., Cases heard: 15CF75, 15CF267, 14CM708 & 14 CM686, Defendant Kasey Ray Huber in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  ADA Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing statements made. In 15CF75, Court sentenced defendant to 45 days jail, consecutive to all other cases. Huber granted under jail rules. $443 costs. In 14CM708, Court withheld sentence, 2 years probation, $649.22 restitution, 10 percent surcharge of $64.92 totaling $714.14, seek employment. $243 costs. In 14CM686, Court imposed 90 days jail, consecutive to all other cases. Huber granted under jail rules. $1,720 fine, 60 days to pay or payment plan. 18 month revocation, 12 month IID. Complete AODA, follow all treatment recommendations. In 15CF267, Court imposed  on ct. 1, 120 days jail, commence forth with. Huber granted under jail rules. $2,502 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up payment plan. 27 month revocation, 24 month IID. Complete AODA, follow all treatment recommendations. 6 days jail credit. On count 2, Court withheld sentence, 3 yrs. probation, Conditions: $518 costs. Submit DNA sample. No use/possession of alcohol, illicit drugs or paraphernalia. Not enter any place who primary purposed is the sale of alcohol: bars/liquor stores, etc. Complete AODA & comply with treatment. Full-time employment,education or combination of both. Comply with risk and needs assessments and other screening tools identified by Dept. of Corrections. Comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs and follow through with any programming recommended by Dept. of Corrections. Court granted 6 days jail credit.  Court adjourned at 4:22 p.m.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Dane County Jail for Feb. 8, 2016 at 3:30 p.m.
from Probation Agent Brian Reynolds re: completion of PSI - by fax
